<div style="position:absolute; left:2.8px; top:388px"><style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1063604349">.mw-parser-output .navbar{display:inline;font-size:88%;font-weight:normal}.mw-parser-output .navbar-collapse{float:left;text-align:left}.mw-parser-output .navbar-boxtext{word-spacing:0}.mw-parser-output .navbar ul{display:inline-block;white-space:nowrap;line-height:inherit}.mw-parser-output .navbar-brackets::before{margin-right:-0.125em;content:"[ "}.mw-parser-output .navbar-brackets::after{margin-left:-0.125em;content:" ]"}.mw-parser-output .navbar li{word-spacing:-0.125em}.mw-parser-output .navbar a>span,.mw-parser-output .navbar a>abbr{text-decoration:inherit}.mw-parser-output .navbar-mini abbr{font-variant:small-caps;border-bottom:none;text-decoration:none;cursor:inherit}.mw-parser-output .navbar-ct-full{font-size:114%;margin:0 7em}.mw-parser-output .navbar-ct-mini{font-size:114%;margin:0 4em}</style><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:Israel_Geographical_Map" title="Template:Israel Geographical Map"><abbr title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:Israel_Geographical_Map" title="Template talk:Israel Geographical Map"><abbr title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:Israel_Geographical_Map&amp;action=edit"><abbr title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div></div>
<div style="position:absolute; font-size:85%; left:115px; top:80px"><a href="/wiki/Galilee" title="Galilee">Galilee</a></div>
<div style="position:absolute; font-size:85%; left:62.2px; top:124px"><a href="/wiki/Israeli_coastal_plain" title="Israeli coastal plain">Coastal<br/>plain</a></div>
<div style="position:absolute; font-size:85%; left:90.8px; top:157px"><a href="/wiki/Judaean_Mountains" title="Judaean Mountains">Judaean<br/>Mountains</a></div>
<div style="position:absolute; font-size:85%; left:132.6px; top:97.6px"><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Jordan_Valley_(Middle_East)" title="Jordan Valley (Middle East)">Jordan<br/>Valley</a></div>
<div style="position:absolute; font-size:85%; left:82px; top:245px"><a href="/wiki/Negev" title="Negev">Negev</a></div>
<div style="position:absolute; font-size:85%; left:27px; top:73.4px"><small><a href="/wiki/Levantine_Sea" title="Levantine Sea">Levantine Sea</a><br/>(<a href="/wiki/Mediterranean_Sea" title="Mediterranean Sea">Mediterranean</a>)</small></div>
<div style="position:absolute; font-size:85%; left:137px; top:60.2px"><small><a href="/wiki/Sea_of_Galilee" title="Sea of Galilee">Kinneret</a></small></div>
<div style="position:absolute; font-size:85%; left:139.2px; top:183.4px"><small><a href="/wiki/Dead_Sea" title="Dead Sea">Dead<br/>Sea</a></small></div>
<div style="position:absolute; font-size:85%; left:64.4px; top:372.6px"><small><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Gulf_of_Eilat" title="Gulf of Eilat">Gulf<br/>of Eilat</a></small></div>
<div style="position:absolute; font-size:85%; left:117.2px; top:124px"><small><i><a href="/wiki/West_Bank" title="West Bank"><span style="color:gray;">West<br/>Bank</span></a></i></small></div>
<div style="position:absolute; font-size:85%; left:42.4px; top:185.6px"><small><i><a href="/wiki/Gaza_Strip" title="Gaza Strip"><span style="color:gray;">Gaza<br/>Strip</span></a></i></small></div>
<div style="position:absolute; font-size:85%; left:134.8px; top:3px"><small><i><a href="/wiki/Lebanon" title="Lebanon"><span style="color:gray;">Lebanon</span></a></i></small></div>
<div style="position:absolute; font-size:85%; left:194.2px; top:5.2px"><small><i><a href="/wiki/Syria" title="Syria"><span style="color:gray;">Syria</span></a></i></small></div>
<div style="position:absolute; font-size:85%; left:181px; top:168px"><small><i><a href="/wiki/Jordan" title="Jordan"><span style="color:gray;">Jordan</span></a></i></small></div>
<div style="position:absolute; font-size:85%; left:27px; top:278px"><small><i><a href="/wiki/Egypt" title="Egypt"><span style="color:gray;">Egypt</span></a></i></small></div>
</div>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1096954695/mw-parser-output/.tmulti" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="thumb tmulti tright"><div class="thumbinner multiimageinner" style="width:212px;max-width:212px"><div class="trow"><div class="tsingle" style="width:100px;max-width:100px"><div class="thumbimage" style="height:233px;overflow:hidden"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Satellite_image_of_Israel_in_January_2003.jpg"><img alt="" data-file-height="1731" data-file-width="727" decoding="async" height="233" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c9/Satellite_image_of_Israel_in_January_2003.jpg/98px-Satellite_image_of_Israel_in_January_2003.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c9/Satellite_image_of_Israel_in_January_2003.jpg/147px-Satellite_image_of_Israel_in_January_2003.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c9/Satellite_image_of_Israel_in_January_2003.jpg/196px-Satellite_image_of_Israel_in_January_2003.jpg 2x" width="98"/></a></div></div><div class="tsingle" style="width:108px;max-width:108px"><div class="thumbimage" style="height:233px;overflow:hidden"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Israel_at_night.jpg"><img alt="" data-file-height="934" data-file-width="425" decoding="async" height="233" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/60/Israel_at_night.jpg/106px-Israel_at_night.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/60/Israel_at_night.jpg/159px-Israel_at_night.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/60/Israel_at_night.jpg/212px-Israel_at_night.jpg 2x" width="106"/></a></div></div></div><div class="trow" style="display:flex"><div class="thumbcaption"><a href="/wiki/Satellite_imagery" title="Satellite imagery">Satellite images</a> of Israel and neighboring territories during the day and night</div></div></div></div>
<p>Israel is located in the <a href="/wiki/Levant" title="Levant">Levant</a> area of the <a href="/wiki/Fertile_Crescent" title="Fertile Crescent">Fertile Crescent</a> region. The country is at the <a href="/wiki/Eastern_Mediterranean" title="Eastern Mediterranean">eastern end</a> of the <a href="/wiki/Mediterranean_Sea" title="Mediterranean Sea">Mediterranean Sea</a>, bounded by Lebanon to the north, Syria to the northeast, Jordan and the West Bank to the east, and Egypt and the Gaza Strip to the southwest. It lies between latitudes <a href="/wiki/29th_parallel_north" title="29th parallel north">29°</a> and <a href="/wiki/34th_parallel_north" title="34th parallel north">34° N</a>, and longitudes <a href="/wiki/34th_meridian_east" title="34th meridian east">34°</a> and <a href="/wiki/36th_meridian_east" title="36th meridian east">36° E</a>.
</p><p>The sovereign territory of Israel (according to the demarcation lines of the <a href="/wiki/1949_Armistice_Agreements" title="1949 Armistice Agreements">1949 Armistice Agreements</a> and excluding all territories captured by Israel during the 1967 <a href="/wiki/Six-Day_War" title="Six-Day War">Six-Day War</a>) is approximately 20,770 square kilometers (8,019 sq mi) in area, of which two percent is water.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-cia_297-0"><a href="#cite_note-cia-297">[290]</a></sup> However Israel is so narrow (100 km at its widest, compared to 400 km from north to south) that the <a href="/wiki/Exclusive_economic_zone" title="Exclusive economic zone">exclusive economic zone</a> in the Mediterranean is double the land area of the country.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-298"><a href="#cite_note-298">[291]</a></sup> The total area under Israeli law, including <a href="/wiki/East_Jerusalem" title="East Jerusalem">East Jerusalem</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Golan_Heights" title="Golan Heights">Golan Heights</a>, is 22,072 square kilometers (8,522 sq mi),<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-299"><a href="#cite_note-299">[292]</a></sup> and the total area under Israeli control, including the military-controlled and partially <a href="/wiki/Palestinian_National_Authority" title="Palestinian National Authority">Palestinian-governed</a> territory of the <a href="/wiki/West_Bank" title="West Bank">West Bank</a>, is 27,799 square kilometers (10,733 sq mi).<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-loc-geo_300-0"><a href="#cite_note-loc-geo-300">[293]</a></sup>
</p><p>Despite its small size, Israel is home to a variety of geographic features, from the <a href="/wiki/Negev" title="Negev">Negev</a> desert in the south to the inland fertile <a href="/wiki/Jezreel_Valley" title="Jezreel Valley">Jezreel Valley</a>, mountain ranges of the <a href="/wiki/Galilee" title="Galilee">Galilee</a>, <a href="/wiki/Mount_Carmel" title="Mount Carmel">Carmel</a> and toward the <a href="/wiki/Golan_Heights" title="Golan Heights">Golan</a> in the north. The <a href="/wiki/Israeli_coastal_plain" title="Israeli coastal plain">Israeli coastal plain</a> on the shores of the Mediterranean is home to most of the nation's population.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-301"><a href="#cite_note-301">[294]</a></sup> East of the central highlands lies the <a href="/wiki/Jordan_Rift_Valley" title="Jordan Rift Valley">Jordan Rift Valley</a>, which forms a small part of the 6,500-kilometer (4,039 mi) <a href="/wiki/Great_Rift_Valley" title="Great Rift Valley">Great Rift Valley</a>. The <a href="/wiki/Jordan_River" title="Jordan River">Jordan River</a> runs along the Jordan Rift Valley, from <a href="/wiki/Mount_Hermon" title="Mount Hermon">Mount Hermon</a> through the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Hulah_Valley" title="Hulah Valley">Hulah Valley</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Sea_of_Galilee" title="Sea of Galilee">Sea of Galilee</a> to the <a href="/wiki/Dead_Sea" title="Dead Sea">Dead Sea</a>, the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Extreme_points_of_Earth" title="Extreme points of Earth">lowest point</a> on the surface of the Earth.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-302"><a href="#cite_note-302">[295]</a></sup> Further south is the <a href="/wiki/Arabah" title="Arabah">Arabah</a>, ending with the <a href="/wiki/Gulf_of_Aqaba" title="Gulf of Aqaba">Gulf of Eilat</a>, part of the <a href="/wiki/Red_Sea" title="Red Sea">Red Sea</a>. <a href="/wiki/Makhtesh" title="Makhtesh">Makhtesh</a>, or "erosion cirques" are unique to the <a href="/wiki/Negev" title="Negev">Negev</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Sinai_Peninsula" title="Sinai Peninsula">Sinai Peninsula</a>, the largest being the <a href="/wiki/Makhtesh_Ramon" title="Makhtesh Ramon">Makhtesh Ramon</a> at 38 km in length.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-303"><a href="#cite_note-303">[296]</a></sup> A report on the environmental status of the <a href="/wiki/Mediterranean_Basin" title="Mediterranean Basin">Mediterranean Basin</a> states that Israel has the largest number of plant species per square meter of all the countries in the basin.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-rinat_304-0"><a href="#cite_note-rinat-304">[297]</a></sup> Israel contains four terrestrial ecoregions: <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Eastern_Mediterranean_conifer-sclerophyllous-broadleaf_forests" title="Eastern Mediterranean conifer-sclerophyllous-broadleaf forests">Eastern Mediterranean conifer-sclerophyllous-broadleaf forests</a>, <a href="/wiki/Southern_Anatolian_montane_conifer_and_deciduous_forests" title="Southern Anatolian montane conifer and deciduous forests">Southern Anatolian montane conifer and deciduous forests</a>, <a href="/wiki/Arabian_Desert" title="Arabian Desert">Arabian Desert</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Mesopotamian_shrub_desert" title="Mesopotamian shrub desert">Mesopotamian shrub desert</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-DinersteinOlson2017_305-0"><a href="#cite_note-DinersteinOlson2017-305">[298]</a></sup> It had a 2019 <a href="/wiki/Forest_Landscape_Integrity_Index" title="Forest Landscape Integrity Index">Forest Landscape Integrity Index</a> mean score of 4.14/10, ranking it 135th globally out of 172 countries.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FLII-Supplementary_306-0"><a href="#cite_note-FLII-Supplementary-306">[299]</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Tectonics_and_seismicity">Tectonics and seismicity</span></h3>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">Further information: <a href="/wiki/List_of_earthquakes_in_the_Levant" title="List of earthquakes in the Levant">List of earthquakes in the Levant</a></div>
<p>The <a href="/wiki/Jordan_Rift_Valley" title="Jordan Rift Valley">Jordan Rift Valley</a> is the result of tectonic movements within the <a href="/wiki/Dead_Sea_Transform" title="Dead Sea Transform">Dead Sea Transform</a> (DSF) fault system. The DSF forms the <a href="/wiki/Transform_fault" title="Transform fault">transform boundary</a> between the <a href="/wiki/African_Plate" title="African Plate">African Plate</a> to the west and the <a href="/wiki/Arabian_Plate" title="Arabian Plate">Arabian Plate</a> to the east. The Golan Heights and all of <a href="/wiki/Jordan" title="Jordan">Jordan</a> are part of the Arabian Plate, while the Galilee, West Bank, Coastal Plain, and Negev along with the Sinai Peninsula are on the African Plate. This tectonic disposition leads to a relatively high <a href="/wiki/List_of_earthquakes_in_the_Levant" title="List of earthquakes in the Levant">seismic activity in the region</a>. The entire Jordan Valley segment is thought to have ruptured repeatedly, for instance during the last two major <a href="/wiki/Geography_of_Israel#Seismic_activity" title="Geography of Israel">earthquakes</a> along this structure in <a href="/wiki/749_Galilee_earthquake" title="749 Galilee earthquake">749</a> and <a href="/wiki/1033_Jordan_Rift_Valley_earthquake" title="1033 Jordan Rift Valley earthquake">1033</a>. The deficit in <a href="/wiki/Fault_(geology)#Slip,_heave,_throw" title="Fault (geology)">slip</a> that has built up since the 1033 event is sufficient to cause an earthquake of M<sub>w</sub> ~7.4.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Ferry_307-0"><a href="#cite_note-Ferry-307">[300]</a></sup>
</p><p>The most catastrophic known earthquakes occurred in 31 BCE, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Galilee_earthquake_of_363" title="Galilee earthquake of 363">363</a>, 749, and 1033 CE, that is every <abbr title="circa">ca.</abbr> 400 years on average.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-MarcoAFTAU_308-0"><a href="#cite_note-MarcoAFTAU-308">[301]</a></sup> Destructive earthquakes leading to serious loss of life strike about every 80 years.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-IllPreped_309-0"><a href="#cite_note-IllPreped-309">[302]</a></sup> While stringent construction regulations are currently in place and recently built structures are earthquake-safe, as of 2007<sup class="plainlinks noexcerpt noprint asof-tag update" style="display:none;"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Israel&amp;action=edit">[update]</a></sup> the majority of the buildings in Israel were older than these regulations and many public buildings as well as 50,000 residential buildings did not meet the new standards and were "expected to collapse" if exposed to a strong earthquake.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-IllPreped_309-1"><a href="#cite_note-IllPreped-309">[302]</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Climate">Climate</span></h3>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">Further information: <a href="/wiki/Climate_change_in_Israel" title="Climate change in Israel">Climate change in Israel</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:262px;"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Koppen-Geiger_Map_ISR_present.svg"><img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="850" data-file-width="1124" decoding="async" height="197" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ea/Koppen-Geiger_Map_ISR_present.svg/260px-Koppen-Geiger_Map_ISR_present.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ea/Koppen-Geiger_Map_ISR_present.svg/390px-Koppen-Geiger_Map_ISR_present.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ea/Koppen-Geiger_Map_ISR_present.svg/520px-Koppen-Geiger_Map_ISR_present.svg.png 2x" width="260"/></a> <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Koppen-Geiger_Map_ISR_present.svg" title="Enlarge"></a></div><a href="/wiki/K%C3%B6ppen_climate_classification" title="Köppen climate classification">Köppen climate classification</a> map of Israel and the <a href="/wiki/Golan_Heights" title="Golan Heights">Golan Heights</a></div></div></div>
<p>Temperatures in Israel vary widely, especially during the winter. Coastal areas, such as those of <a href="/wiki/Tel_Aviv" title="Tel Aviv">Tel Aviv</a> and <a href="/wiki/Haifa" title="Haifa">Haifa</a>, have a typical <a href="/wiki/Mediterranean_climate" title="Mediterranean climate">Mediterranean climate</a> with cool, rainy winters and long, hot summers. The area of <a href="/wiki/Beersheba" title="Beersheba">Beersheba</a> and the Northern Negev have a <a href="/wiki/Semi-arid_climate" title="Semi-arid climate">semi-arid climate</a> with hot summers, cool winters, and fewer rainy days than the Mediterranean climate. The Southern Negev and the Arava areas have a <a href="/wiki/Desert_climate" title="Desert climate">desert climate</a> with very hot, dry summers, and mild winters with few days of rain. The highest temperature in the world outside Africa and North America as of 2021<sup class="plainlinks noexcerpt noprint asof-tag update" style="display:none;"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Israel&amp;action=edit">[update]</a></sup>, 54 °C (129 °F), was recorded in 1942 in the <a href="/wiki/Tirat_Zvi" title="Tirat Zvi">Tirat Zvi</a> kibbutz in the northern Jordan River valley.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-watzman_310-0"><a href="#cite_note-watzman-310">[303]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-311"><a href="#cite_note-311">[304]</a></sup>
</p><p>At the other extreme, mountainous regions can be windy and cold, and areas at elevation of 750 metres (2,460 ft) or more (same elevation as Jerusalem) will usually receive at least one <a href="/wiki/Snow_in_Israel" title="Snow in Israel">snowfall</a> each year.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-312"><a href="#cite_note-312">[305]</a></sup> From May to September, rain in Israel is rare.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-313"><a href="#cite_note-313">[306]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-314"><a href="#cite_note-314">[307]</a></sup> With scarce water resources, Israel has developed various water-saving technologies, including <a href="/wiki/Drip_irrigation" title="Drip irrigation">drip irrigation</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-315"><a href="#cite_note-315">[308]</a></sup> Israelis also take advantage of the considerable sunlight available for <a href="/wiki/Solar_energy" title="Solar energy">solar energy</a>, making <a href="/wiki/Solar_power_in_Israel" title="Solar power in Israel">Israel the leading nation in solar energy</a> use per capita—practically every house uses solar panels for water heating.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Solar_energy_316-0"><a href="#cite_note-Solar_energy-316">[309]</a></sup>
</p><p>There are four different <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Phytogeographic" title="Phytogeographic">phytogeographic</a> regions in Israel, due to the country's location between the temperate and tropical zones, bordering the Mediterranean Sea in the west and the desert in the east. For this reason, the flora and fauna of Israel are extremely diverse. There are 2,867 known <a href="/wiki/List_of_endemic_flora_of_Israel" title="List of endemic flora of Israel">species of plants found in Israel</a>. Of these, at least 253 species are <a href="/wiki/List_of_adventive_wild_plants_in_Israel" title="List of adventive wild plants in Israel">introduced</a> and non-native.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-317"><a href="#cite_note-317">[310]</a></sup> There are 380 <a href="/wiki/National_parks_and_nature_reserves_of_Israel" title="National parks and nature reserves of Israel">Israeli nature reserves</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-318"><a href="#cite_note-318">[311]</a></sup>
</p><p>The Israeli <a href="/wiki/Ministry_of_Environmental_Protection_(Israel)" title="Ministry of Environmental Protection (Israel)">Ministry of Environmental Protection</a> has reported that <a href="/wiki/Climate_change_in_Israel" title="Climate change in Israel">climate change</a> "will have a decisive impact on all areas of life, including: water, public health, agriculture, energy, biodiversity, coastal infrastructure, economics, nature, national security, and geostrategy", and will have the greatest effect on vulnerable populations such as the poor, the elderly, and the chronically ill.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-MEP_2020_319-0"><a href="#cite_note-MEP_2020-319">[312]</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Demographics">Demographics</span></h2>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">Main articles: <a href="/wiki/Demographics_of_Israel" title="Demographics of Israel">Demographics of Israel</a> and <a href="/wiki/Israelis" title="Israelis">Israelis</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Israelpop.svg"><img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="600" data-file-width="800" decoding="async" height="165" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/06/Israelpop.svg/220px-Israelpop.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/06/Israelpop.svg/330px-Israelpop.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/06/Israelpop.svg/440px-Israelpop.svg.png 2x" width="220"/></a> <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Israelpop.svg" title="Enlarge"></a></div><a href="/wiki/Population_pyramid" title="Population pyramid">Population pyramid</a> of Israel</div></div></div>
<p>As of 31 August 2021<sup class="plainlinks noexcerpt noprint asof-tag update" style="display:none;"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Israel&amp;action=edit">[update]</a></sup>, Israel's population was an estimated 9,393,500. In 2019, the civil government recorded 74.2% of the population as <a href="/wiki/Israeli_Jews" title="Israeli Jews">Jews</a>, 20.9% of the population as <a href="/wiki/Arab_citizens_of_Israel" title="Arab citizens of Israel">Arabs</a>, and 4.8% as non-Arab Christians and people who have no religion listed.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-population_stat2019_16-2"><a href="#cite_note-population_stat2019-16">[13]</a></sup> Over the last decade, large numbers of migrant workers from <a href="/wiki/Romania" title="Romania">Romania</a>, <a href="/wiki/Thailand" title="Thailand">Thailand</a>, <a href="/wiki/China" title="China">China</a>, Africa, and South America have settled in Israel. Exact figures are unknown, as many of them are living in the country illegally,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-320"><a href="#cite_note-320">[313]</a></sup> but estimates run from 166,000<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-population_stat2019_16-3"><a href="#cite_note-population_stat2019-16">[13]</a></sup> to 203,000.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Adriana_Kemp_321-0"><a href="#cite_note-Adriana_Kemp-321">[314]</a></sup> By June 2012, approximately 60,000 <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Illegal_immigration_from_Africa_to_Israel" title="Illegal immigration from Africa to Israel">African migrants</a> had entered Israel.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-322"><a href="#cite_note-322">[315]</a></sup> About 92% of Israelis live in urban areas.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-323"><a href="#cite_note-323">[316]</a></sup> 90% of <a href="/wiki/Palestinian_citizens_of_Israel" title="Palestinian citizens of Israel">Palestinian Israelis</a> reside in 139 densely populated towns and villages concentrated in the Galilee, <a href="/wiki/Triangle_(Israel)" title="Triangle (Israel)">Triangle</a> and <a href="/wiki/Negev" title="Negev">Negev</a> regions, with the remaining 10% in <a href="/wiki/Mixed_cities" title="Mixed cities">mixed cities</a> and neighborhoods.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-324"><a href="#cite_note-324">[317]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-325"><a href="#cite_note-325">[318]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-326"><a href="#cite_note-326">[319]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-327"><a href="#cite_note-327">[320]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-328"><a href="#cite_note-328">[321]</a></sup> Data published by the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Organisation_for_Economic_Co-operation_and_Development" title="Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development">OECD</a> in 2016 estimated the average <a href="/wiki/Life_expectancy" title="Life expectancy">life expectancy</a> of Israelis at 82.5 years, making it the <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_life_expectancy" title="List of countries by life expectancy">6th-highest in the world</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-OECD_life_expec_329-0"><a href="#cite_note-OECD_life_expec-329">[322]</a></sup> Israeli Arab life expectancy lags behind by 3 to 4 years,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-330"><a href="#cite_note-330">[323]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-331"><a href="#cite_note-331">[324]</a></sup> still highest among Arabs or Muslims in the world.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-332"><a href="#cite_note-332">[325]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-333"><a href="#cite_note-333">[326]</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:302px;"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Aliyah_1948-2015.png"><img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="642" data-file-width="1617" decoding="async" height="119" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ce/Aliyah_1948-2015.png/300px-Aliyah_1948-2015.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ce/Aliyah_1948-2015.png/450px-Aliyah_1948-2015.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ce/Aliyah_1948-2015.png/600px-Aliyah_1948-2015.png 2x" width="300"/></a> <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Aliyah_1948-2015.png" title="Enlarge"></a></div><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Immigration_to_Israel" title="Immigration to Israel">Immigration to Israel</a> in the years 1948–2015. The two peaks were in 1949 and 1990.</div></div></div>
<p>Israel was established as a <a href="/wiki/Homeland_for_the_Jewish_people" title="Homeland for the Jewish people">homeland for the Jewish people</a> and is often referred to as a <a href="/wiki/Jewish_state" title="Jewish state">Jewish state</a>. The country's <a href="/wiki/Law_of_Return" title="Law of Return">Law of Return</a> grants all Jews and those of Jewish ancestry the right to <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Israeli_nationality_law" title="Israeli nationality law">Israeli citizenship</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-334"><a href="#cite_note-334">[327]</a></sup> Retention of Israel's population since 1948 is about even or greater, when compared to other countries with mass immigration.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-335"><a href="#cite_note-335">[328]</a></sup> Jewish emigration from Israel (called <i><a href="/wiki/Yerida" title="Yerida">yerida</a></i> in Hebrew), primarily to the United States and Canada, is described by demographers as modest,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-336"><a href="#cite_note-336">[329]</a></sup> but is often cited by Israeli government ministries as a major threat to Israel's future.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-337"><a href="#cite_note-337">[330]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-338"><a href="#cite_note-338">[331]</a></sup>
</p><p>Three quarters of the population are Jews from a <a href="/wiki/Jewish_ethnic_divisions" title="Jewish ethnic divisions">diversity of Jewish backgrounds</a>. Approximately 75% of <a href="/wiki/Israeli_Jews" title="Israeli Jews">Israeli Jews</a> are <a href="/wiki/Sabra_(person)" title="Sabra (person)">born in Israel</a>,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-population_stat2019_16-4"><a href="#cite_note-population_stat2019-16">[13]</a></sup> 16% are immigrants from Europe and the Americas, and 7% are immigrants from Asia and Africa (including the <a href="/wiki/Arab_world" title="Arab world">Arab world</a>).<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-339"><a href="#cite_note-339">[332]</a></sup> Jews from Europe and the former <a href="/wiki/Soviet_Union" title="Soviet Union">Soviet Union</a> and their descendants born in Israel, including <a href="/wiki/Ashkenazi_Jews" title="Ashkenazi Jews">Ashkenazi Jews</a>, constitute approximately 50% of Jewish Israelis. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Jewish_exodus_from_Arab_and_Muslim_countries" title="Jewish exodus from Arab and Muslim countries">Jews who left or fled Arab and Muslim countries</a> and their descendants, including both <a href="/wiki/Mizrahi_Jews" title="Mizrahi Jews">Mizrahi</a> and <a href="/wiki/Sephardi_Jews" title="Sephardi Jews">Sephardi</a> Jews,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-340"><a href="#cite_note-340">[333]</a></sup> form most of the rest of the Jewish population.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-341"><a href="#cite_note-341">[334]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-342"><a href="#cite_note-342">[335]</a></sup> Jewish intermarriage rates run at over 35% and recent studies suggest that the percentage of Israelis descended from both Sephardi and Ashkenazi Jews increases by 0.5 percent every year, with over 25% of school children now originating from both communities.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-343"><a href="#cite_note-343">[336]</a></sup> Around 4% of Israelis (300,000), ethnically defined as "others", are <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/1990s_Post-Soviet_aliyah" title="1990s Post-Soviet aliyah">Russian descendants</a> of Jewish origin or family who are not Jewish according to rabbinical law, but were eligible for Israeli citizenship under the Law of Return.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-DellaPergola,_Sergio_2011_344-0"><a href="#cite_note-DellaPergola,_Sergio_2011-344">[337]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Israel_people_345-0"><a href="#cite_note-Israel_people-345">[338]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-346"><a href="#cite_note-346">[339]</a></sup>
</p><p>The total number of <a href="/wiki/Israeli_settlement" title="Israeli settlement">Israeli settlers</a> beyond the <a href="/wiki/Green_Line_(Israel)" title="Green Line (Israel)">Green Line</a> is over 600,000 (≈10% of the Jewish Israeli population).<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-347"><a href="#cite_note-347">[340]</a></sup> In 2016<sup class="plainlinks noexcerpt noprint asof-tag update" style="display:none;"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Israel&amp;action=edit">[update]</a></sup>, 399,300 Israelis <a href="/wiki/Population_statistics_for_Israeli_settlements_in_the_West_Bank" title="Population statistics for Israeli settlements in the West Bank">lived</a> in <a href="/wiki/West_Bank" title="West Bank">West Bank</a> settlements,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-districts_pop_348-0"><a href="#cite_note-districts_pop-348">[341]</a></sup> including those that predated the establishment of the State of Israel and which were re-established after the <a href="/wiki/Six-Day_War" title="Six-Day War">Six-Day War</a>, in cities such as <a href="/wiki/Hebron" title="Hebron">Hebron</a> and <a href="/wiki/Gush_Etzion" title="Gush Etzion">Gush Etzion</a> bloc. In addition to the West Bank settlements, there were more than 200,000 Jews living in <a href="/wiki/East_Jerusalem" title="East Jerusalem">East Jerusalem</a>,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-jerusalem_pop_349-0"><a href="#cite_note-jerusalem_pop-349">[342]</a></sup> and 22,000 in the <a href="/wiki/Golan_Heights" title="Golan Heights">Golan Heights</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-districts_pop_348-1"><a href="#cite_note-districts_pop-348">[341]</a></sup> Approximately 7,800 Israelis <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Population_statistics_for_Israeli_Gaza_Strip_settlements" title="Population statistics for Israeli Gaza Strip settlements">lived in settlements</a> in the Gaza Strip, known as <a href="/wiki/Gush_Katif" title="Gush Katif">Gush Katif</a>, until they were evacuated by the government as part of its 2005 <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Israel%27s_unilateral_disengagement_plan" title="Israel's unilateral disengagement plan">disengagement plan</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-350"><a href="#cite_note-350">[343]</a></sup>
</p><p>Israeli Arabs (including the Arab population of East Jerusalem and the Golan Heights) comprise 21.1% of the population or 1,995,000 people.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-351"><a href="#cite_note-351">[344]</a></sup> In a 2017 telephone poll, 40% of Arab citizens of Israel identified as "Arab in Israel" or "Arab citizen of Israel", 15% identified as "Palestinian", 8.9% as "Palestinian in Israel" or "Palestinian citizen of Israel", and 8.7% as "Arab"; 60% of Israeli Arabs have a positive view of the state.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-352"><a href="#cite_note-352">[345]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-353"><a href="#cite_note-353">[346]</a></sup>  According to <a href="/wiki/Sammy_Smooha" title="Sammy Smooha">Sammy Smooha</a>, "The identity of 83.0% of the Arabs in 2019 (up from 75.5% in 2017) has an Israeli component and 61.9% (unchanged from 60.3%) has a Palestinian component. However, when these two components were presented as competitors, 69.0% of the Arabs in 2019 chose exclusive or primary Palestinian identity, compared with 29.8% who chose exclusive or primary Israeli Arab identity."<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-354"><a href="#cite_note-354">[347]</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Major_urban_areas">Major urban areas</span></h3>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">For a more comprehensive list, see <a href="/wiki/List_of_cities_in_Israel" title="List of cities in Israel">List of cities in Israel</a>.</div>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">See also: <a href="/wiki/West_Jerusalem" title="West Jerusalem">West Jerusalem</a></div>
<div class="thumb tnone" style="margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;overflow:hidden;width:auto;max-width:1008px"><div class="thumbinner"><div class="noresize" style="overflow:auto"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Tel_Aviv_Panorama.jpg" title="View over the Tel Aviv Metropolitan Area"><img alt="" data-file-height="987" data-file-width="4863" decoding="async" height="203" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/93/Tel_Aviv_Panorama.jpg/1000px-Tel_Aviv_Panorama.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/93/Tel_Aviv_Panorama.jpg/1500px-Tel_Aviv_Panorama.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/93/Tel_Aviv_Panorama.jpg/2000px-Tel_Aviv_Panorama.jpg 2x" width="1000"/></a></div><div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Tel_Aviv_Panorama.jpg" title="File:Tel Aviv Panorama.jpg"> </a></div>View over the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Tel_Aviv_Metropolitan_Area" title="Tel Aviv Metropolitan Area">Tel Aviv Metropolitan Area</a></div></div></div>
<p>Israel has four major metropolitan areas: <a href="/wiki/Gush_Dan" title="Gush Dan">Gush Dan</a> (Tel Aviv metropolitan area; population 3,854,000), <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Jerusalem_metropolitan_area" title="Jerusalem metropolitan area">Jerusalem metropolitan area</a> (population 1,253,900), <a href="/wiki/Haifa_metropolitan_area" title="Haifa metropolitan area">Haifa metropolitan area</a> (population 924,400), and <a href="/wiki/Beersheba_metropolitan_area" title="Beersheba metropolitan area">Beersheba metropolitan area</a> (population 377,100).<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-355"><a href="#cite_note-355">[348]</a></sup>
</p><p>Israel's largest municipality, in population and area, is <a href="/wiki/Jerusalem" title="Jerusalem">Jerusalem</a> with 936,425 residents in an area of 125 square kilometres (48 sq mi).<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Israelpopulations_356-0"><a href="#cite_note-Israelpopulations-356">[349]</a></sup> Israeli government statistics on Jerusalem include the population and area of <a href="/wiki/East_Jerusalem" title="East Jerusalem">East Jerusalem</a>, which is widely recognized as part of the <a href="/wiki/Palestinian_territories" title="Palestinian territories">Palestinian territories</a> under <a href="/wiki/Israeli-occupied_territories" title="Israeli-occupied territories">Israeli occupation</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-357"><a href="#cite_note-357">[350]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Tel_Aviv" title="Tel Aviv">Tel Aviv</a> and <a href="/wiki/Haifa" title="Haifa">Haifa</a> rank as Israel's next most populous cities, with populations of 460,613 and 285,316, respectively.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Israelpopulations_356-1"><a href="#cite_note-Israelpopulations-356">[349]</a></sup>
The (mainly <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Haredi" title="Haredi">Haredi</a>) city of <a href="/wiki/Bnei_Brak" title="Bnei Brak">Bnei Brak</a> is the most densely populated city in Israel and one of the <a href="/wiki/List_of_cities_proper_by_population_density" title="List of cities proper by population density">10 most densely populated cities</a> in the world.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-358"><a href="#cite_note-358">[351]</a></sup>
</p><p>Israel has 16 <a href="/wiki/List_of_cities_in_Israel" title="List of cities in Israel">cities</a> with populations over 100,000. In all, there are 77 Israeli localities granted <a href="/wiki/City_council_(Israel)" title="City council (Israel)">"municipalities" (or "city") status</a> by the Ministry of the Interior,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-359"><a href="#cite_note-359">[352]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/List_of_Israeli_settlements_with_city_status_in_the_West_Bank" title="List of Israeli settlements with city status in the West Bank">four of which are in the West Bank</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-360"><a href="#cite_note-360">[353]</a></sup> Two more cities are planned: <a href="/wiki/Kasif,_Israel" title="Kasif, Israel">Kasif</a>, a <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Planned_city" title="Planned city">planned city</a> to be built in the <a href="/wiki/Negev" title="Negev">Negev</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Harish,_Israel" title="Harish, Israel">Harish</a>, originally a small town that is being built into a large city since 2015.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-361"><a href="#cite_note-361">[354]</a></sup>
</p>
<div>
<table style="font-size:88%;margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 100%; border: 1px solid darkgray; background: #f9f9f9">

<th colspan="10" style="padding:0.3em 0.75em;"><div style="float:right; width:6em; height:2.6em"> </div><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini" style="float: left;height:2.6em;"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:Largest_cities_of_Israel" title="Template:Largest cities of Israel"><abbr title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:Largest_cities_of_Israel" title="Template talk:Largest cities of Israel"><abbr title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:Largest_cities_of_Israel&amp;action=edit"><abbr title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div> <div style="height:2.6em;line-height:1.3em;"><span style="font-size:110%;">Largest cities in Israel</span><br/><div style="display:inline;font-weight:normal;"><a href="/wiki/Israel_Central_Bureau_of_Statistics" title="Israel Central Bureau of Statistics">Israel Central Bureau of Statistics</a><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Israelpopulations_356-2"><a href="#cite_note-Israelpopulations-356">[349]</a></sup></div></div>
</th></tr>

<td rowspan="11" style="text-align: center"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Jerusalem_Dome_of_the_rock_BW_14.JPG" title="Jerusalem"><img alt="Jerusalem" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="2540" data-file-width="3812" decoding="async" height="80" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c2/Jerusalem_Dome_of_the_rock_BW_14.JPG/120px-Jerusalem_Dome_of_the_rock_BW_14.JPG" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c2/Jerusalem_Dome_of_the_rock_BW_14.JPG/180px-Jerusalem_Dome_of_the_rock_BW_14.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c2/Jerusalem_Dome_of_the_rock_BW_14.JPG/240px-Jerusalem_Dome_of_the_rock_BW_14.JPG 2x" width="120"/></a><br/><a href="/wiki/Jerusalem" title="Jerusalem">Jerusalem</a><br/><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Hashalom_interchange.jpg" title="Tel Aviv"><img alt="Tel Aviv" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="2160" data-file-width="4096" decoding="async" height="63" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/98/Hashalom_interchange.jpg/120px-Hashalom_interchange.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/98/Hashalom_interchange.jpg/180px-Hashalom_interchange.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/98/Hashalom_interchange.jpg/240px-Hashalom_interchange.jpg 2x" width="120"/></a><br/><a href="/wiki/Tel_Aviv" title="Tel Aviv">Tel Aviv</a>
</td>
