<li id="cite_note-237"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-237">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/John_Quigley_(academic)" title="John Quigley (academic)">John Quigley</a>, <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=0zEi3qGWLFIC&amp;pg=PA32" rel="nofollow"><i>The Six-Day War and Israeli Self-Defense: Questioning the Legal Basis for Preventive War</i></a>, Cambridge University Press, 2013, p. 32.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-238"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-238">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFSamir_A._Mutawi2002">Samir A. Mutawi (2002). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=g9bBJusRJIMC" rel="nofollow"><i>Jordan in the 1967 War</i></a>. Cambridge University Press. p. 93. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-521-52858-0" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-521-52858-0"><bdi>978-0-521-52858-0</bdi></a>. <q>Although Eshkol denounced the Egyptians, his response to this development was a model of moderation. His speech on 21 May demanded that Nasser withdraw his forces from Sinai but made no mention of the removal of UNEF from the Straits nor of what Israel would do if they were closed to Israeli shipping. The next day Nasser announced to an astonished world that henceforth the Straits were, indeed, closed to all Israeli ships</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Jordan+in+the+1967+War&amp;rft.pages=93&amp;rft.pub=Cambridge+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2002&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-521-52858-0&amp;rft.au=Samir+A.+Mutawi&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3Dg9bBJusRJIMC&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-239"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-239">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFSegev2007">Segev 2007</a>, p. 289</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-240"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-240">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFSmith2006">Smith 2006</a>, p. 126. "Nasser, the Egyptian president, decided to mass troops in the Sinai<span class="nowrap"> </span>... <i>casus belli</i> by Israel."</span>
</li>

</li>

<li id="cite_note-loc-geo-300"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-loc-geo_300-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://lcweb2.loc.gov/frd/cs/iltoc.html" rel="nofollow">"Israel (Geography)"</a>. <i>Country Studies</i>. 7 May 2009<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-Ferry-307"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Ferry_307-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFFerry_M.Meghraoui_M.Karaki_A.A.Al-Taj_M.2008">Ferry M.; Meghraoui M.; Karaki A.A.; Al-Taj M.; Amoush H.; Al-Dhaisat S.; Barjous M. (2008). "A 48-kyr-long slip rate history for the Jordan Valley segment of the Dead Sea Fault". <i>Earth and Planetary Science Letters</i>. <b>260</b> (3–4): 394–406. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Bibcode_(identifier)" title="Bibcode (identifier)">Bibcode</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://ui.adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/2007E&amp;PSL.260..394F" rel="nofollow">2007E&amp;PSL.260..394F</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1016%2Fj.epsl.2007.05.049" rel="nofollow">10.1016/j.epsl.2007.05.049</a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Earth+and+Planetary+Science+Letters&amp;rft.atitle=A+48-kyr-long+slip+rate+history+for+the+Jordan+Valley+segment+of+the+Dead+Sea+Fault&amp;rft.volume=260&amp;rft.issue=3%E2%80%934&amp;rft.pages=394-406&amp;rft.date=2008&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1016%2Fj.epsl.2007.05.049&amp;rft_id=info%3Abibcode%2F2007E%26PSL.260..394F&amp;rft.au=Ferry+M.&amp;rft.au=Meghraoui+M.&amp;rft.au=Karaki+A.A.&amp;rft.au=Al-Taj+M.&amp;rft.au=Amoush+H.&amp;rft.au=Al-Dhaisat+S.&amp;rft.au=Barjous+M.&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-MarcoAFTAU-308"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-MarcoAFTAU_308-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">American Friends of the Tel Aviv University, <i>Earthquake Experts at Tel Aviv University Turn to History for Guidance</i> (4 October 2007). Quote: The major ones were recorded along the Jordan Valley in the years 31 B.C.E., 363 C.E., 749 C.E., and 1033 C.E. "So roughly, we are talking about an interval of every 400 years. If we follow the patterns of nature, a major quake should be expected any time because almost a whole millennium has passed since the last strong earthquake of 1033." (Tel Aviv University Associate Professor Dr. Shmuel (Shmulik) Marco). <a class="external autonumber" href="http://www.aftau.org/news-page-environment--ecology?storyid4703=2015&amp;ncs4703=3" rel="nofollow">[1]</a> <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20200811164733/https://www.aftau.org/news-page-environment--ecology?storyid4703=2015&amp;ncs4703=3" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> 11 August 2020 at the <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-IllPreped-309"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-IllPreped_309-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-IllPreped_309-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Zafrir Renat, <i>Israel Is Due, and Ill Prepared, for Major Earthquake</i>, Haaretz, 15 January 2010. "On average, a destructive earthquake takes place in Israel once every 80 years, causing serious casualties and damage." <a class="external autonumber" href="http://www.haaretz.com/israel-is-due-and-ill-prepared-for-a-major-earthquake-1.261497" rel="nofollow">[2]</a></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-watzman-310"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-watzman_310-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFWatzman1997">Watzman, Haim (8 February 1997). <a class="external text" href="https://www.newscientist.com/article/mg15320684.400-left-for-dead.html" rel="nofollow">"Left for dead"</a>. <i>New Scientist</i>. London<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">20 March</span> 2012</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=New+Scientist&amp;rft.atitle=Left+for+dead&amp;rft.date=1997-02-08&amp;rft.aulast=Watzman&amp;rft.aufirst=Haim&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.newscientist.com%2Farticle%2Fmg15320684.400-left-for-dead.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-311"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-311">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://wmo.asu.edu/content/wmo-region-vi-europe-highest-temperature" rel="nofollow">"WMO Region 6: Highest Temperature"</a>. <li id="cite_note-320"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-320">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://www.irinnews.org/Report/85270/ISRAEL-Crackdown-on-illegal-migrants-and-visa-violators" rel="nofollow">"ISRAEL: Crackdown on illegal migrants and visa violators"</a>. <i>IRIN</i>. 14 July 2009.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=IRIN&amp;rft.atitle=ISRAEL%3A+Crackdown+on+illegal+migrants+and+visa+violators&amp;rft.date=2009-07-14&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.irinnews.org%2FReport%2F85270%2FISRAEL-Crackdown-on-illegal-migrants-and-visa-violators&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-322"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-322">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-israel-africans-idUSBRE85A0VI20120611" rel="nofollow">"Israel rounds up African migrants for deportation"</a>. <i>Reuters</i>. 11 June 2012.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Reuters&amp;rft.atitle=Israel+rounds+up+African+migrants+for+deportation&amp;rft.date=2012-06-11&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.reuters.com%2Farticle%2Fus-israel-africans-idUSBRE85A0VI20120611&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-323"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-323">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20130607003443/http://www.mfa.gov.il/mfa/aboutisrael/land/pages/the%20land-%20urban%20life.aspx" rel="nofollow">"The Land: Urban Life"</a>. Israel Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://mfa.gov.il/MFA/AboutIsrael/Land/Pages/THE%20LAND-%20Urban%20Life.aspx" rel="nofollow">the original</a> on 7 June 2013.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=The+Land%3A+Urban+Life&amp;rft.pub=Israel+Ministry+of+Foreign+Affairs&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fmfa.gov.il%2FMFA%2FAboutIsrael%2FLand%2FPages%2FTHE%2520LAND-%2520Urban%2520Life.aspx&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-324"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-324">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a class="external text" href="https://www.amnesty.org/en/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/MDE1551412022ENGLISH.pdf" rel="nofollow"><i>Israel's Apartheid against Palestinians: Cruel System of Domnination and Crime Against Humanity,</i></a> <a href="/wiki/Amnesty_International" title="Amnesty International">Amnesty International</a>  2022 p.16:'Today, Palestinian citizens and permanent residents of Israel comprise some 21% of Israel's population and number approximately 1.9 million. Some 90% of Palestinians with Israeli citizenship live in 139 densely populated towns and villages in the Galilee and Triangle regions in northern Israel and the Negev/Naqab region in the south, as a result of deliberate segregation policies. The vast majority of the remaining 10% live in "mixed cities".'</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-325"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-325">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a class="external text" href="https://www.hrw.org/sites/default/files/media_2021/04/israel_palestine0421_web_0.pdf" rel="nofollow">'A Threshold Crossed,' </a> <a href="/wiki/Human_Rights_Watch" title="Human Rights Watch">Human Rights Watch</a> 27 April 2021  pp.7,57–63:' This policy, which aims to maximize Jewish Israeli control over land,  concentrates the majority of Palestinians who live outside Israel's major, predominantly Jewish cities into dense, under-served enclaves and restricts their access to land and housing, while nurturing the growth of nearby Jewish communities.'</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-326"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-326">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Nimer_Sultany" title="Nimer Sultany">Nimer Sultany</a>,  <a class="external text" href="https://www.jstor.org/stable/41804808" rel="nofollow">'The Making of an Underclass: The Palestinian Citizens of Israel,'</a> <a href="/wiki/Israel_Studies_Review" title="Israel Studies Review">Israel Studies Review</a>  Vol. 27, No. 2, (Winter 2012), pp. 190–200  pp.191,194.'the Palestinian Israeli population grew from 156,000 in 1948 to 1.4 million in 2012. Their villages became overcrowded as their land reserves steadily decreased. The lands were transferred from Palestinian private hands to state control. . .While the state has established hundreds of Jewish communities, it has not established any new Palestinian communities since 1948—except in the forced concentration of the Bedouin communities in poor towns.'</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-327"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-327">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Gershon Shafir , <a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1017/S0020743817000915" rel="nofollow">From Overt to Veiled Segregation: Israel's Palestinian Arab Citizens in the Galilee</a>,   <a href="/wiki/International_Journal_of_Middle_East_Studies" title="International Journal of Middle East Studies">International Journal of Middle East Studies</a>, Volume 50 Issue 1 February 2018, pp.1–22 pp.4,7:' With about 90 percent of Israel's Palestinian citizens living in Arab-only towns and villages, they suffer from the hypersegregation typical of African American urban neighborhoods and its attendant deleterious consequences. This remarkable similarity, however, has different origins...Palestinian residents in old mixed cities are congregated into distinct neighborhoods, whereas in new mixed cities they form distinct enclaves, distinguished by strong family and communal ties'</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-328"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-328">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2021/06/04/can-jews-palestinians-live-peacefully-israel-data-mixed-neighborhoods-says-yes/" rel="nofollow">"Can Jews and Palestinians live peacefully in Israel? The data on mixed neighborhoods says yes"</a>. <i>Washington Post</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">15 February</span> 2022</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Washington+Post&amp;rft.atitle=Can+Jews+and+Palestinians+live+peacefully+in+Israel%3F+The+data+on+mixed+neighborhoods+says+yes&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.washingtonpost.com%2Fpolitics%2F2021%2F06%2F04%2Fcan-jews-palestinians-live-peacefully-israel-data-mixed-neighborhoods-says-yes%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-OECD_life_expec-329"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-OECD_life_expec_329-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://data.oecd.org/healthstat/life-expectancy-at-birth.htm" rel="nofollow">"Health status – Life expectancy at birth – OECD Data"</a>. <i>theOECD</i>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=theOECD&amp;rft.atitle=Health+status+%E2%80%93+Life+expectancy+at+birth+%E2%80%93+OECD+Data&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fdata.oecd.org%2Fhealthstat%2Flife-expectancy-at-birth.htm&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-330"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-330">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.france24.com/en/20200329-arab-and-jewish-medics-together-on-frontline-of-israel-s-virus-fight" rel="nofollow">"Arab and Jewish medics together on frontline of Israel's virus fight"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/France_24" title="France 24">France 24</a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Agence_France_Presse" title="Agence France Presse">Agence France Presse</a></i>. 29 March 2020<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">23 June</span> 2022</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=France+24%2C+Agence+France+Presse&amp;rft.atitle=Arab+and+Jewish+medics+together+on+frontline+of+Israel%27s+virus+fight&amp;rft.date=2020-03-29&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.france24.com%2Fen%2F20200329-arab-and-jewish-medics-together-on-frontline-of-israel-s-virus-fight&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-331"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-331">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Dov Chernichovsky, Bishara Bisharat, Liora Bowers, Aviv Brill, and Chen Sharony, <a class="external text" href="https://www.taubcenter.org.il/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/healthofthearabisraelipopulation.pdf" rel="nofollow">"The Health of the Arab Israeli Population"</a>. Taub Center for Social Policy Studies in Israel December 2017 pp.1–50, 13 (2015)</span>
</li>

Retrieved <span class="nowrap">19 September</span> 2017</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Population+of+Jerusalem%2C+by+Age%2C+Religion+and+Geographical+Spreading%2C+2015&amp;rft.pub=Jerusalem+Institute+for+Israel+Studies&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.jerusaleminstitute.org.il%2F.upload%2Fyearbook%2F2017%2Fshnaton_C1017.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-350"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-350">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20130826025402/http://www.fmep.org/settlement_info/settlement-info-and-tables/stats-data/settlements-in-the-gaza-strip-1" rel="nofollow">"Settlements in the Gaza Strip"</a>. <i>Settlement Information</i>. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://www.fmep.org/settlement_info/settlement-info-and-tables/stats-data/settlements-in-the-gaza-strip-1" rel="nofollow">the original</a> on 26 August 2013<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">12 December</span> 2007</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Settlement+Information&amp;rft.atitle=Settlements+in+the+Gaza+Strip&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.fmep.org%2Fsettlement_info%2Fsettlement-info-and-tables%2Fstats-data%2Fsettlements-in-the-gaza-strip-1&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-351"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-351">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.cbs.gov.il/en/mediarelease/Pages/2021/Population-of-Israel-on-the-Eve-of-2022.aspx" rel="nofollow">"Population of Israel on the Eve of 2022"</a>. Cbs.gov.il<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">13 February</span> 2022</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Population+of+Israel+on+the+Eve+of+2022&amp;rft.pub=Cbs.gov.il&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cbs.gov.il%2Fen%2Fmediarelease%2FPages%2F2021%2FPopulation-of-Israel-on-the-Eve-of-2022.aspx&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-352"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-352">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Konrad_Adenauer_Foundation" title="Konrad Adenauer Foundation">Konrad Adenauer Foundation</a>. <a class="external text" href="http://www.kas.de/wf/doc/kas_51217-544-2-30.pdf?171228130254" rel="nofollow">Citizenship, Identity and Political Participation: Measuring the Attitudes of the Arab Citizens in Israel, December 2017: pages 22, 25 and 28; quote (p.28): "The positions of the participants in the focus groups reflect the strength of Palestinian-Arab identity among Arab citizens and the fact that they do not see a contradiction between Palestinian-Arab national identity and Israeli civic identity. The designation "Israeli-Arab" aroused great opposition in the focus groups, as did Israel's Independence Day. A comparison of views expressed in the focus groups with the general results of the survey points to differences between collective positions and memory and individual feelings and attitudes. The collective position presented in the focus group discussions finds expression in the public sphere and emphasizes the Palestinian national identity. Conversely, the responses of the survey participants reveal individual attitudes that assign a broader (albeit secondary, identity) dimension to the component of Israeli civic identity"; quote (p.25): "Amongst the participants there was consensus that Palestinian identity occupies a central place in their consciousness. The definition "Palestinian" has national and emotional importance, as it embodies the heritage of Arab citizens and their culture. This was expressed explicitly in the words of the participants: "We are Palestinian Arabs and we say this with pride;""We are Palestinian citizens of Israel. The emphasis is on the word 'Palestinians'"; "I am first and foremost a Palestinian and nothing more." The designation "Arab citizens of Israel" was acceptable to them on the basis of the understanding that it is impossible to live without citizenship, and as long as Israeli citizenship does not harm the national consciousness. Conversely, the participants spoke out against the designation "Arab-Israeli" and made statements such as "I am an Arab, I belong to a larger culture than the State of Israel"; "We are not the Arabs of Israel, I am an Arab who does not belong to the State of Israel. My roots and my Arabness existed before them." "[Arab-Israeli] is an inappropriate expression because our ancestors were here before '48."</a></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-353"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-353">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFLynfield2017">Lynfield, Ben (27 September 2017). <a class="external text" href="http://www.jpost.com/Israel-News/Survey-60-percent-of-Arab-Israelis-have-positive-view-of-state-506150" rel="nofollow">"Survey: 60% of Arab Israelis have positive view of state"</a>. <i>The Jerusalem Post | JPost.com</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-357"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-357">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFRoberts1990">Roberts 1990</a>, p. 60 Although East Jerusalem and the Golan Heights have been brought directly under Israeli law, by acts that amount to annexation, both of these areas continue to be viewed by the international community as occupied, and their status as regards the applicability of international rules is in most respects identical to that of the West Bank and Gaza.</span>

<li id="cite_note-365"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-365">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFMeyer2008">Meyer, Bill (17 August 2008). <a class="external text" href="http://www.cleveland.com/world/index.ssf/2008/08/israels_welcome_for_ethiopian.html" rel="nofollow">"Israel's welcome for Ethiopian Jews wears thin"</a>. <i>The Plain Dealer</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">1 October</span> 2012</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+Plain+Dealer&amp;rft.atitle=Israel%27s+welcome+for+Ethiopian+Jews+wears+thin&amp;rft.date=2008-08-17&amp;rft.aulast=Meyer&amp;rft.aufirst=Bill&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.cleveland.com%2Fworld%2Findex.ssf%2F2008%2F08%2Fisraels_welcome_for_ethiopian.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-366"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-366">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://www.haaretz.com/news/study-soviet-immigrants-outperform-israeli-students-1.238970" rel="nofollow">"Study: Soviet immigrants outperform Israeli students"</a>. <i>Haaretz</i>. 10 February 2008.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Haaretz&amp;rft.atitle=Study%3A+Soviet+immigrants+outperform+Israeli+students&amp;rft.date=2008-02-10&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.haaretz.com%2Fnews%2Fstudy-soviet-immigrants-outperform-israeli-students-1.238970&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-367"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-367">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4156781,00.html" rel="nofollow">"French radio station RFI makes aliyah"</a>. <i>Ynetnews</i>. 5 December 2011.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Ynetnews&amp;rft.atitle=French+radio+station+RFI+makes+aliyah&amp;rft.date=2011-12-05&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.ynetnews.com%2Farticles%2F0%2C7340%2CL-4156781%2C00.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-368"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-368">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFSpolsky1999">Spolsky, Bernard (1999). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=ljumbfV_7y0C&amp;pg=PAPA169" rel="nofollow"><i>Round Table on Language and Linguistics</i></a>. Washington, DC: Georgetown University Press. pp. 169–170. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-87840-132-1" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-87840-132-1"><bdi>978-0-87840-132-1</bdi></a>. <q>In 1948, the newly independent state of Israel took over the old British regulations that had set English, Arabic, and Hebrew as official languages for Mandatory Palestine but, as mentioned, dropped English from the list. In spite of this, official language use has maintained a de facto role for English, after Hebrew but before Arabic.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Round+Table+on+Language+and+Linguistics&amp;rft.place=Washington%2C+DC&amp;rft.pages=169-170&amp;rft.pub=Georgetown+University+Press&amp;rft.date=1999&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-87840-132-1&amp;rft.aulast=Spolsky&amp;rft.aufirst=Bernard&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DljumbfV_7y0C%26pg%3DPAPA169&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-369"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-369">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFBat-Zeev_Shyldkrot2004">Bat-Zeev Shyldkrot, Hava (2004). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=xMzx6xFB0IgC&amp;pg=PAPA90" rel="nofollow">"Part I: Language and Discourse"</a>.  In Diskin Ravid, Dorit; Bat-Zeev Shyldkrot, Hava (eds.). <i>Perspectives on Language and Development: Essays in Honor of Ruth A. Berman</i>. Kluwer Academic Publishers. p. 90. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-4020-7911-5" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-4020-7911-5"><bdi>978-1-4020-7911-5</bdi></a>. <q>English is not considered official but it plays a dominant role in the educational and public life of Israeli society. ... It is the language most widely used in commerce, business, formal papers, academia, and public interactions, public signs, road directions, names of buildings, etc. English behaves 'as if' it were the second and official language in Israel.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=Part+I%3A+Language+and+Discourse&amp;rft.btitle=Perspectives+on+Language+and+Development%3A+Essays+in+Honor+of+Ruth+A.+Berman&amp;rft.pages=90&amp;rft.pub=Kluwer+Academic+Publishers&amp;rft.date=2004&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-4020-7911-5&amp;rft.aulast=Bat-Zeev+Shyldkrot&amp;rft.aufirst=Hava&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DxMzx6xFB0IgC%26pg%3DPAPA90&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-370"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-370">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFShohamy2006">Shohamy, Elana (2006). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=5mG09P64jzYC&amp;pg=PAPA72" rel="nofollow"><i>Language Policy: Hidden Agendas and New Approaches</i></a>. Routledge. pp. 72–73. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-415-32864-7" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-415-32864-7"><bdi>978-0-415-32864-7</bdi></a>. <q>In terms of English, there is no connection between the declared policies and statements and de facto practices. While English is not declared anywhere as an official language, the reality is that it has a very high and unique status in Israel. It is the main language of the academy, commerce, business, and the public space.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Language+Policy%3A+Hidden+Agendas+and+New+Approaches&amp;rft.pages=72-73&amp;rft.pub=Routledge&amp;rft.date=2006&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-415-32864-7&amp;rft.aulast=Shohamy&amp;rft.aufirst=Elana&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3D5mG09P64jzYC%26pg%3DPAPA72&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-371"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-371">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://mfa.gov.il/MFA/IsraelExperience/AboutIsrael/Education/Pages/English_programs_Israeli_universities_colleges.aspx" rel="nofollow">"English programs at Israeli universities and colleges"</a>. Israel Ministry of Foreign Affairs.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=English+programs+at+Israeli+universities+and+colleges&amp;rft.pub=Israel+Ministry+of+Foreign+Affairs&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fmfa.gov.il%2FMFA%2FIsraelExperience%2FAboutIsrael%2FEducation%2FPages%2FEnglish_programs_Israeli_universities_colleges.aspx&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-404"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-404">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://news.walla.co.il/item/1232268" rel="nofollow">"עולים מחבר העמים מצליחים יותר בבגרויות"</a>. <i>וואלה! חדשות</i>. 10 February 2008.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=%D7%95%D7%95%D7%90%D7%9C%D7%94%21+%D7%97%D7%93%D7%A9%D7%95%D7%AA&amp;rft.atitle=%D7%A2%D7%95%D7%9C%D7%99%D7%9D+%D7%9E%D7%97%D7%91%D7%A8+%D7%94%D7%A2%D7%9E%D7%99%D7%9D+%D7%9E%D7%A6%D7%9C%D7%99%D7%97%D7%99%D7%9D+%D7%99%D7%95%D7%AA%D7%A8+%D7%91%D7%91%D7%92%D7%A8%D7%95%D7%99%D7%95%D7%AA&amp;rft.date=2008-02-10&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fnews.walla.co.il%2Fitem%2F1232268&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-414"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-414">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">In 1996, direct elections for the prime minister were inaugurated, but the system was declared unsatisfactory and the old one reinstated. See <link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/2683259.stm" rel="nofollow">"Israel's election process explained"</a>. <i>BBC News</i>. 23 January 2003<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">31 March</span> 2010</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=BBC+News&amp;rft.atitle=Israel%27s+election+process+explained&amp;rft.date=2003-01-23&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fnews.bbc.co.uk%2F2%2Fhi%2Fmiddle_east%2F2683259.stm&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-415"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-415">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.knesset.gov.il/description/eng/eng_mimshal_beh.htm" rel="nofollow">"The Electoral System in Israel"</a>. The Knesset<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">8 August</span> 2007</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=The+Electoral+System+in+Israel&amp;rft.pub=The+Knesset&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.knesset.gov.il%2Fdescription%2Feng%2Feng_mimshal_beh.htm&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-416"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-416">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a class="external text" href="https://www.foxnews.com/world/jewish-settlers-can-vote-in-israeli-elections-though-west-bank-is-officially-not-israel" rel="nofollow">Jewish settlers can vote in Israeli elections, though West Bank is officially not Israel</a>, Fox News, February 2015: "When Israelis go to the polls next month, tens of thousands of Jewish settlers in the West Bank will also be casting votes, even though they do not live on what is sovereign Israeli territory. This exception in a country that doesn't allow absentee voting for citizens living abroad is a telling reflection of Israel's somewhat ambiguous and highly contentious claim to the territory, which has been under military occupation for almost a half century."</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-417"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-417">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a class="external text" href="https://en.idi.org.il/articles/5199" rel="nofollow">The Social Composition of the 20th Knesset</a>, Israeli Democracy Institute, 30 March 2015</span>

<li id="cite_note-418"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-418">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFHalbfingerMcCann2020">Halbfinger, David M.; McCann, Allison (28 February 2020). <a class="external text" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/02/28/world/middleeast/israel-arabs-election-vote.html" rel="nofollow">"As Israel Votes Again (and Again), Arabs See an Opportunity"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_New_York_Times" title="The New York Times">The New York Times</a></i>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISSN_(identifier)" title="ISSN (identifier)">ISSN</a> <a class="external text" href="//www.worldcat.org/issn/0362-4331" rel="nofollow">0362-4331</a>. <a class="external text" href="https://archive.today/20220106024835/https://www.nytimes.com/2020/02/28/world/middleeast/israel-arabs-election-vote.html%23commentsContainer" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 6 January 2022.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+New+York+Times&amp;rft.atitle=As+Israel+Votes+Again+%28and+Again%29%2C+Arabs+See+an+Opportunity&amp;rft.date=2020-02-28&amp;rft.issn=0362-4331&amp;rft.aulast=Halbfinger&amp;rft.aufirst=David+M.&amp;rft.au=McCann%2C+Allison&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes.com%2F2020%2F02%2F28%2Fworld%2Fmiddleeast%2Fisrael-arabs-election-vote.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-419"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-419">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFMazie2006">Mazie 2006</a>, p. 34</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-420"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-420">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFCharbit2014">Charbit, Denis (2014). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=gThvBAAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PAPA167" rel="nofollow">"Israel's Self-Restrained Secularism from the 1947 Status Quo Letter to the Present"</a>.  In Berlinerblau, Jacques; Fainberg, Sarah; Nou, Aurora (eds.). <i>Secularism on the Edge: Rethinking Church-State Relations in the United States, France, and Israel</i>. New York: Palgrave Macmillan. pp. 167–169. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-137-38115-6" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-137-38115-6"><bdi>978-1-137-38115-6</bdi></a>. <q>The compromise, therefore, was to choose constructive ambiguity: as surprising as it may seem, there is no law that declares Judaism the official religion of Israel. However, there is no other law that declares Israel's neutrality toward all confessions. Judaism is not recognized as the official religion of the state, and even though the Jewish, Muslim and Christian clergy receive their salaries from the state, this fact does not make Israel a neutral state. This apparent pluralism cannot dissimulate the fact that Israel displays a clear and undoubtedly hierarchical pluralism in religious matters. ... It is important to note that from a multicultural point of view, this self-restrained secularism allows Muslim law to be practiced in Israel for personal matters of the Muslim community. As surprising as it seems, if not paradoxical for a state in war, Israel is the only Western democratic country in which Sharia enjoys such an official status.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=Israel%27s+Self-Restrained+Secularism+from+the+1947+Status+Quo+Letter+to+the+Present&amp;rft.btitle=Secularism+on+the+Edge%3A+Rethinking+Church-State+Relations+in+the+United+States%2C+France%2C+and+Israel&amp;rft.place=New+York&amp;rft.pages=167-169&amp;rft.pub=Palgrave+Macmillan&amp;rft.date=2014&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-137-38115-6&amp;rft.aulast=Charbit&amp;rft.aufirst=Denis&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DgThvBAAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPAPA167&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-421"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-421">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFSharot2007">Sharot, Stephen (2007). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=vA8edg7bv0kC&amp;pg=PAPA671" rel="nofollow">"Judaism in Israel: Public Religion, Neo-Traditionalism, Messianism, and Ethno-Religious Conflict"</a>.  In Beckford, James A.; Demerath, Jay (eds.). <i>The Sage Handbook of the Sociology of Religion</i>. London and Thousand Oaks, CA: Sage Publications. pp. 671–672. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-4129-1195-5" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-4129-1195-5"><bdi>978-1-4129-1195-5</bdi></a>. <q>It is true that Jewish Israelis, and secular Israelis in particular, conceive of religion as shaped by a state-sponsored religious establishment. There is no formal state religion in Israel, but the state gives its official recognition and financial support to particular religious communities, Jewish, Islamic and Christian, whose religious authorities and courts are empowered to deal with matters of personal status and family law, such as marriage, divorce, and alimony, that are binding on all members of the communities.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=Judaism+in+Israel%3A+Public+Religion%2C+Neo-Traditionalism%2C+Messianism%2C+and+Ethno-Religious+Conflict&amp;rft.btitle=The+Sage+Handbook+of+the+Sociology+of+Religion&amp;rft.place=London+and+Thousand+Oaks%2C+CA&amp;rft.pages=671-672&amp;rft.pub=Sage+Publications&amp;rft.date=2007&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-4129-1195-5&amp;rft.aulast=Sharot&amp;rft.aufirst=Stephen&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DvA8edg7bv0kC%26pg%3DPAPA671&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-422"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-422">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFJacoby2005">Jacoby, Tami Amanda (2005). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=pr1LJNrlmuIC&amp;pg=PAPA53" rel="nofollow"><i>Women in Zones of Conflict: Power and Resistance in Israel</i></a>. Montreal, Quebec and Kingston, Ontario: McGill-Queen's University Press. pp. 53–54. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-7735-2993-9" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-7735-2993-9"><bdi>978-0-7735-2993-9</bdi></a>. <q>Although there is no official religion in Israel, there is also no clear separation between religion and state. In Israeli public life, tensions frequently arise among different streams of Judaism: Ultra-Orthodox, National-Religious, <i>Mesorati</i> (Conservative), Reconstructionist Progressive (Reform), and varying combinations of traditionalism and non-observance. Despite this variety in religious observances in society, Orthodox Judaism prevails institutionally over the other streams. This boundary is an historical consequence of the unique evolution of the relationship between Israel nationalism and state building. ... Since the founding period, in order to defuse religious tensions, the State of Israel has adopted what is known as the 'status quo,' an unwritten agreement stipulating that no further changes would be made in the status of religion, and that conflict between the observant and non-observant sectors would be handled circumstantially. The 'status quo' has since pertained to the legal status of both religious and secular Jews in Israel. This situation was designed to appease the religious sector, and has been upheld indefinitely through the disproportionate power of religious political parties in all subsequent coalition governments. ... On one hand, the Declaration of Independence adopted in 1948 explicitly guarantees freedom of religion. On the other, it simultaneously prevents the separation of religion and state in Israel.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Women+in+Zones+of+Conflict%3A+Power+and+Resistance+in+Israel&amp;rft.place=Montreal%2C+Quebec+and+Kingston%2C+Ontario&amp;rft.pages=53-54&amp;rft.pub=McGill-Queen%27s+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2005&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-7735-2993-9&amp;rft.aulast=Jacoby&amp;rft.aufirst=Tami+Amanda&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3Dpr1LJNrlmuIC%26pg%3DPAPA53&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-423"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-423">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFEnglard1987">Englard, Izhak (Winter 1987). "Law and Religion in Israel". <i>The American Journal of Comparative Law</i>. <b>35</b> (1): 185–208. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.2307%2F840166" rel="nofollow">10.2307/840166</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/JSTOR_(identifier)" title="JSTOR (identifier)">JSTOR</a> <a class="external text" href="//www.jstor.org/stable/840166" rel="nofollow">840166</a>. <q>The great political and ideological importance of religion in the state of Israel manifests itself in the manifold legal provisions concerned with religions phenomenon. ... It is not a system of separation between state and religion as practiced in the U.S.A and several other countries of the world. In Israel a number of religious bodies exercise official functions; the religious law is applied in limited areas</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+American+Journal+of+Comparative+Law&amp;rft.atitle=Law+and+Religion+in+Israel&amp;rft.ssn=winter&amp;rft.volume=35&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.pages=185-208&amp;rft.date=1987&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.2307%2F840166&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fwww.jstor.org%2Fstable%2F840166%23id-name%3DJSTOR&amp;rft.aulast=Englard&amp;rft.aufirst=Izhak&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-424"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-424">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-44881554" rel="nofollow">"Jewish nation state: Israel approves controversial bill"</a>. BBC. 19 July 2018<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">20 July</span> 2018</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.atitle=Jewish+nation+state%3A+Israel+approves+controversial+bill&amp;rft.date=2018-07-19&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bbc.com%2Fnews%2Fworld-middle-east-44881554&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-judiciary-425"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-judiciary_425-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-judiciary_425-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://www.mfa.gov.il/MFA/Government/Branches%20of%20Government/Judicial/The%20Judiciary-%20The%20Court%20System" rel="nofollow">"The Judiciary: The Court System"</a>. <li id="cite_note-429"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-429">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://www.idi.org.il/%D7%A1%D7%A4%D7%A8%D7%99%D7%9D-%D7%95%D7%9E%D7%90%D7%9E%D7%A8%D7%99%D7%9D/%D7%A4%D7%A8%D7%9C%D7%9E%D7%A0%D7%98/%D7%92%D7%99%D7%9C%D7%99%D7%95%D7%9F-72/%D7%94%D7%9C%D7%99%D7%9A-%D7%9E%D7%99%D7%A0%D7%95%D7%99-%D7%94%D7%A9%D7%95%D7%A4%D7%98%D7%99%D7%9D-%D7%91%D7%99%D7%A9%D7%A8%D7%90%D7%9C-%D7%A2%D7%95%D7%91%D7%93-%D7%90%D7%9C-%D7%AA%D7%99%D7%92%D7%A2%D7%95!/" rel="nofollow">"הליך מינוי השופטים בישראל: עובד – אל תיגעו!"</a>. <a href="/wiki/Israel_Democracy_Institute" title="Israel Democracy Institute">Israel Democracy Institute</a><span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-430"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-430">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFSuzi_Navot2007">Suzi Navot (2007). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=YUNNHYUBA5oC&amp;pg=PAPA146" rel="nofollow"><i>Constitutional Law of Israel</i></a>. Kluwer Law International. p. 146. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-90-411-2651-1" title="Special:BookSources/978-90-411-2651-1"><bdi>978-90-411-2651-1</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Constitutional+Law+of+Israel&amp;rft.pages=146&amp;rft.pub=Kluwer+Law+International&amp;rft.date=2007&amp;rft.isbn=978-90-411-2651-1&amp;rft.au=Suzi+Navot&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DYUNNHYUBA5oC%26pg%3DPAPA146&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-Ben-NaftaliSfard2018-431"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Ben-NaftaliSfard2018_431-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFOrna_Ben-NaftaliMichael_SfardHedi_Viterbo2018">Orna Ben-Naftali; Michael Sfard; Hedi Viterbo (2018). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=Is5TDwAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PAPA52" rel="nofollow"><i>The ABC of the OPT: A Legal Lexicon of the Israeli Control over the Occupied Palestinian Territory</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-432"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-432">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20110221195435/http://www.cbs.gov.il/shnaton53/download/st_eng01.doc" rel="nofollow">"Introduction to the Tables: Geophysical Characteristics"</a>. <li id="cite_note-433"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-433">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20120612120152/http://unispal.un.org/UNISPAL.NSF/0/73D6B4C70D1A92B7852560DF0064F101" rel="nofollow">"Resolution 497 (1981)"</a>. <li id="cite_note-434"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-434">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20101231090053/http://domino.un.org/UNISPAL.NSF/0/dde590c6ff232007852560df0065fddb?OpenDocument" rel="nofollow">"East Jerusalem: UNSC Res. 478"</a>. UN. 1980. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://domino.un.org/UNISPAL.NSF/0/dde590c6ff232007852560df0065fddb?OpenDocument" rel="nofollow">the original</a> on 31 December 2010<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">10 April</span> 2010</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=East+Jerusalem%3A+UNSC+Res.+478&amp;rft.pub=UN&amp;rft.date=1980&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fdomino.un.org%2FUNISPAL.NSF%2F0%2Fdde590c6ff232007852560df0065fddb%3FOpenDocument&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Sher-435"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Sher_435-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Sher_435-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Sher_435-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Gilead Sher, <a class="external text" href="http://www.inss.org.il/publication/the-application-of-israeli-law-to-the-west-bank-de-facto-annexation/" rel="nofollow">The Application of Israeli Law to the West Bank: De Facto Annexation?</a>, INSS Insight No. 638, 4 December 2014</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTEOECD2011-436"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEOECD2011_436-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEOECD2011_436-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFOECD2011">OECD 2011</a>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-437"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-437">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a class="external text" href="http://mas.ps/files/server/20141911093442-1.pdf" rel="nofollow"><i>Quarterly Economic and Social Monitor</i></a>, Volume 26, October 2011, p. 57: "When Israel bid in March 2010 for membership in the 'Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development'... some members questioned the accuracy of Israeli statistics, as the Israeli figures (relating to gross domestic product, spending and number of the population) cover geographical areas that the Organization does not recognize as part of the Israeli territory. These areas include East Jerusalem, Israeli settlements in the West Bank and the Golan Heights."</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-occhist-438"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-occhist_438-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">See for example:<br/>* <link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFHajjar2005">Hajjar, Lisa (2005). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=mcjoHq2wqdUC&amp;pg=PAPA96" rel="nofollow"><i>Courting Conflict: The Israeli Military Court System in the West Bank and Gaza</i></a>. University of California Press. p. 96. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-520-24194-7" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-520-24194-7"><bdi>978-0-520-24194-7</bdi></a>. <q>The Israeli occupation of the West Bank and Gaza is the longest military occupation in modern times.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Courting+Conflict%3A+The+Israeli+Military+Court+System+in+the+West+Bank+and+Gaza&amp;rft.pages=96&amp;rft.pub=University+of+California+Press&amp;rft.date=2005&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-520-24194-7&amp;rft.aulast=Hajjar&amp;rft.aufirst=Lisa&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DmcjoHq2wqdUC%26pg%3DPAPA96&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span><br/>* <link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFAnderson2001"><a href="/wiki/Perry_Anderson" title="Perry Anderson">Anderson, Perry</a> (July–August 2001). <a class="external text" href="https://newleftreview.org/article/download_pdf?id=2330" rel="nofollow">"Editorial: Scurrying Towards Bethlehem"</a>. <i>New Left Review</i>. <b>10</b>. <q>longest official military occupation of modern history—currently entering its thirty-fifth year</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=New+Left+Review&amp;rft.atitle=Editorial%3A+Scurrying+Towards+Bethlehem&amp;rft.volume=10&amp;rft.date=2001-07%2F2001-08&amp;rft.aulast=Anderson&amp;rft.aufirst=Perry&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fnewleftreview.org%2Farticle%2Fdownload_pdf%3Fid%3D2330&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span><br/>* <link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFMakdisi2010"><a href="/wiki/Saree_Makdisi" title="Saree Makdisi">Makdisi, Saree</a> (2010). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=2dBM3Ago2BAC&amp;pg=PAPA299" rel="nofollow"><i>Palestine Inside Out: An Everyday Occupation</i></a>. W.W. Norton &amp; Company. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-393-33844-7" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-393-33844-7"><bdi>978-0-393-33844-7</bdi></a>. <q>longest-lasting military occupation of the modern age</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Palestine+Inside+Out%3A+An+Everyday+Occupation&amp;rft.pub=W.W.+Norton+%26+Company&amp;rft.date=2010&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-393-33844-7&amp;rft.aulast=Makdisi&amp;rft.aufirst=Saree&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3D2dBM3Ago2BAC%26pg%3DPAPA299&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span><br/>* <link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFKretzmer2012"><a href="/wiki/David_Kretzmer" title="David Kretzmer">Kretzmer, David</a> (Spring 2012). <a class="external text" href="https://www.icrc.org/eng/assets/files/review/2012/irrc-885-kretzmer.pdf" rel="nofollow">"The law of belligerent occupation in the Supreme Court of Israel"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <i>International Review of the Red Cross</i>. <b>94</b> (885): 207–236. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1017%2FS1816383112000446" rel="nofollow">10.1017/S1816383112000446</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/S2CID_(identifier)" title="S2CID (identifier)">S2CID</a> <a class="external text" href="https://api.semanticscholar.org/CorpusID:32105258" rel="nofollow">32105258</a>. <q>This is probably the longest occupation in modern international relations, and it holds a central place in all literature on the law of belligerent occupation since the early 1970s</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Review+of+the+Red+Cross&amp;rft.atitle=The+law+of+belligerent+occupation+in+the+Supreme+Court+of+Israel&amp;rft.ssn=spring&amp;rft.volume=94&amp;rft.issue=885&amp;rft.pages=207-236&amp;rft.date=2012&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1017%2FS1816383112000446&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fapi.semanticscholar.org%2FCorpusID%3A32105258%23id-name%3DS2CID&amp;rft.aulast=Kretzmer&amp;rft.aufirst=David&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.icrc.org%2Feng%2Fassets%2Ffiles%2Freview%2F2012%2Firrc-885-kretzmer.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span><br/>* <link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation cs2" id="CITEREFAlexandrowicz2012">Alexandrowicz, Ra'anan (24 January 2012), <a class="external text" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2012/01/25/opinion/the-justice-of-occupation.html" rel="nofollow">"The Justice of Occupation"</a>, <i>The New York Times</i>, <q>Israel is the only modern state that has held territories under military occupation for over four decades</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+New+York+Times&amp;rft.atitle=The+Justice+of+Occupation&amp;rft.date=2012-01-24&amp;rft.aulast=Alexandrowicz&amp;rft.aufirst=Ra%27anan&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes.com%2F2012%2F01%2F25%2Fopinion%2Fthe-justice-of-occupation.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span><br/>* <link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFWeill2014">Weill, Sharon (2014). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=bDnnAgAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PAPA22" rel="nofollow"><i>The Role of National Courts in Applying International Humanitarian Law</i></a>. Oxford University Press. p. 22. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-19-968542-4" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-19-968542-4"><bdi>978-0-19-968542-4</bdi></a>. <q>Although the basic philosophy behind the law of military occupation is that it is a temporary situation modem occupations have well demonstrated that <i>rien ne dure comme le provisoire</i> A significant number of post-1945 occupations have lasted more than two decades such as the occupations of Namibia by South Africa and of East Timor by Indonesia as well as the ongoing occupations of Northern Cyprus by Turkey and of Western Sahara by Morocco. The Israeli occupation of the Palestinian territories, <span style="text-decoration: underline;">which is the longest in all occupation's history</span> has already entered its fifth decade.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Role+of+National+Courts+in+Applying+International+Humanitarian+Law&amp;rft.pages=22&amp;rft.pub=Oxford+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2014&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-19-968542-4&amp;rft.aulast=Weill&amp;rft.aufirst=Sharon&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DbDnnAgAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPAPA22&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span><br/>* Azarova, Valentina. 2017, <a class="external text" href="http://www.ecfr.eu/publications/summary/israels_unlawfully_prolonged_occupation_7294" rel="nofollow">Israel's Unlawfully Prolonged Occupation: Consequences under an Integrated Legal Framework</a>, European Council on Foreign Affairs Policy Brief: "June 2017 marks 50 years of Israel's belligerent occupation of Palestinian territory, making it the longest occupation in modern history."</span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-449"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-449">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://www.mfa.gov.il/mfa/foreignpolicy/peace/mfadocuments/pages/agreed%20documents%20on%20movement%20and%20access%20from%20and%20to%20gaza%2015-nov-2005.aspx" rel="nofollow">"Agreed documents on movement and access from and to Gaza"</a>. </li>
<li id="cite_note-Slater2020-450"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Slater2020_450-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFJerome_Slater2020">Jerome Slater (1 October 2020). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=yVAAEAAAQBAJ" rel="nofollow"><i>Mythologies Without End: The US, Israel, and the Arab-Israeli Conflict, 1917–2020</i></a>. Oxford University Press. p. 15. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-19-045909-3" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-19-045909-3"><bdi>978-0-19-045909-3</bdi></a>. <q>It is now clear that Israel is a true democracy in its broadest sense only for its Jewish citizens. The Arab-Israeli (or, as some prefer, the Palestinian-Israeli) peoples, roughly 20 percent of the total population of Israel its pre-1967 boundaries, are citizens and have voting rights, but they face political, economic, and social discrimination. And, of course, Israeli democracy is inapplicable to the nearly 4 million Palestinian Arabs in the West Bank and Gaza, conquered by Israel in June 1967, who are occupied, repressed, and in many ways, directly and indirectly, effectively ruled by Israel.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Mythologies+Without+End%3A+The+US%2C+Israel%2C+and+the+Arab-Israeli+Conflict%2C+1917%E2%80%932020&amp;rft.pages=15&amp;rft.pub=Oxford+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2020-10-01&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-19-045909-3&amp;rft.au=Jerome+Slater&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DyVAAEAAAQBAJ&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-White2012-451"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-White2012_451-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFBen_White2012">Ben White (15 January 2012). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=Bp1PXwAACAAJ" rel="nofollow"><i>Palestinians in Israel: Segregation, Discrimination and Democracy</i></a>. Pluto Press. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-7453-3228-4" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-7453-3228-4"><bdi>978-0-7453-3228-4</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Palestinians+in+Israel%3A+Segregation%2C+Discrimination+and+Democracy&amp;rft.pub=Pluto+Press&amp;rft.date=2012-01-15&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-7453-3228-4&amp;rft.au=Ben+White&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DBp1PXwAACAAJ&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-482"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-482">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFBarak-Erez2006">Barak-Erez, Daphne (1 July 2006). <a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1093%2Ficon%2Fmol021" rel="nofollow">"Israel: The security barrier—between international law, constitutional law, and domestic judicial review"</a>. <i>International Journal of Constitutional Law</i>. <b>4</b> (3): 548. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<span class="cs1-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1093%2Ficon%2Fmol021" rel="nofollow">10.1093/icon/mol021</a></span>. <q>The real controversy hovering over all the litigation on the security barrier concerns the fate of the Israeli settlements in the occupied territories. Since 1967, Israel has allowed and even encouraged its citizens to live in the new settlements established in the territories, motivated by religious and national sentiments attached to the history of the Jewish nation in the land of Israel. This policy has also been justified in terms of security interests, taking into consideration the dangerous geographic circumstances of Israel before 1967 (where Israeli areas on the Mediterranean coast were potentially threatened by Jordanian control of the West Bank ridge). The international community, for its part, has viewed this policy as patently illegal, based on the provisions of the Fourth Geneva Convention that prohibit moving populations to or from territories under occupation.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Journal+of+Constitutional+Law&amp;rft.atitle=Israel%3A+The+security+barrier%E2%80%94between+international+law%2C+constitutional+law%2C+and+domestic+judicial+review&amp;rft.volume=4&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.pages=548&amp;rft.date=2006-07-01&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1093%2Ficon%2Fmol021&amp;rft.aulast=Barak-Erez&amp;rft.aufirst=Daphne&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fdoi.org%2F10.1093%252Ficon%252Fmol021&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-485"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-485">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFBerger2022">Berger, Miriam (1 February 2022). <a class="external text" href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2022/02/01/amnesty-international-joining-other-human-rights-groups-says-israel-is-committing-crime-apartheid/" rel="nofollow">"Amnesty International, joining other human rights groups, says Israel is 'committing the crime of apartheid'<span class="cs1-kern-right"></span>"</a>. <i>The Washington Post</i>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISSN_(identifier)" title="ISSN (identifier)">ISSN</a> <a class="external text" href="//www.worldcat.org/issn/0190-8286" rel="nofollow">0190-8286</a><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">15 February</span> 2022</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+Washington+Post&amp;rft.atitle=Amnesty+International%2C+joining+other+human+rights+groups%2C+says+Israel+is+%27committing+the+crime+of+apartheid%27&amp;rft.date=2022-02-01&amp;rft.issn=0190-8286&amp;rft.aulast=Berger&amp;rft.aufirst=Miriam&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.washingtonpost.com%2Fworld%2F2022%2F02%2F01%2Famnesty-international-joining-other-human-rights-groups-says-israel-is-committing-crime-apartheid%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-486"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-486">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.haaretz.com/us-news/u-s-state-department-rejects-amnesty-s-apartheid-claims-against-israel-1.10583830" rel="nofollow">"U.S. State Department Rejects Amnesty's Apartheid Claim Against Israel"</a>. <i>Haaretz</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-526"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-526">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFKumar">Kumar, Dinesh. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20120512233225/http://pakistanyouthmovement.com/Research-Reports/India%20Israel%20Ties.pdf" rel="nofollow">"India and Israel: Dawn of a New Era"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. Jerusalem Institute for Western Defense. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://pakistanyouthmovement.com/Research-Reports/India%20Israel%20Ties.pdf" rel="nofollow">the original</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> on 12 May 2012<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-531"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-531">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFPfeffer2015">Pfeffer, Anshel (28 April 2015). <a class="external text" href="http://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/.premium-1.653988" rel="nofollow">"The Downsides of Israel's Missions of Mercy Abroad"</a>. <i>Haaretz</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">22 November</span> 2015</span>. <q>And even when no Israelis are involved, few countries are as fast as Israel in mobilizing entire delegations to rush to the other side of the world. It has been proved time and again in recent years, after the earthquake in Haiti, the typhoon in the Philippines and the quake/tsunami/nuclear disaster in Japan. For a country of Israel's size and resources, without conveniently located aircraft carriers and overseas bases, it is quite an impressive achievement.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Haaretz&amp;rft.atitle=The+Downsides+of+Israel%27s+Missions+of+Mercy+Abroad&amp;rft.date=2015-04-28&amp;rft.aulast=Pfeffer&amp;rft.aufirst=Anshel&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.haaretz.com%2Fisrael-news%2F.premium-1.653988&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>
</li>

Retrieved <span class="nowrap">26 June</span> 2022</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Reuters&amp;rft.atitle=Israel+gets+first+gas+from+Leviathan+with+exports+to+follow&amp;rft.date=2019-12-31&amp;rft.aulast=Cohen&amp;rft.aufirst=Tova&amp;rft.au=Ari%2C+Rabinovitch&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.reuters.com%2Farticle%2Fus-israel-natgas-leviathan%2Fisrael-gets-first-gas-from-leviathan-with-exports-to-follow-idUSKBN1YZ0H9&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIsrael"></span></span>
